action.action-desc: Ms. DelBene introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify the treatment of certain payments made with respect to sexual misconduct.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop Tax Breaks for Sexual Misconduct Act.

section.header: Treatment of certain payments made with respect to sexual misconduct

subsection.header: Denial of deduction for certain payments made with respect to sexual misconduct
subsection.text: Section 162(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Certain payments made with respect to sexual misconduct
paragraph.text: No deduction shall be allowed under subsection (a) for any amount paid or incurred for—

subparagraph.text: liability insurance providing coverage with respect to sexual misconduct by an employee, or
damages, settlement costs, or attorney’s fees with respect to sexual misconduct by an employee.

subsection.header: Exclusion from gross income of certain amounts received with respect to sexual misconduct
subsection.text: Section 104(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking and at the end of paragraph (5), by striking the period at the end of paragraph (6) and inserting ; and, and by inserting after paragraph (6) the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: amount received as damages or settlement payments on account of injuries due to sexual misconduct.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
